title: Warning Against Adultery
shortSummary: Proverbs Chapter 5 offers a father’s solemn warning to his son about the dangers of adultery and the seductive allure of the 'strange woman.' It contrasts the bitterness and destruction that come from unfaithfulness with the blessing and joy found in marital fidelity and wisdom.

keyCharacters.name: The Father
keyCharacters.description: The speaker who imparts wisdom and instruction to his son, warning him against the temptations of adultery.

keyCharacters.name: The Son
keyCharacters.description: The recipient of the father's wisdom, representing the young man in need of guidance to live a righteous life.

keyCharacters.name: The Strange Woman
keyCharacters.description: A metaphorical figure representing temptation, adultery, and the destructive consequences of unfaithfulness.

definitions.definition: A term used in Proverbs to describe a foreign or adulterous woman who entices men into sin and spiritual ruin.
A bitter herb used metaphorically here to describe the bitterness and sorrow that follow sinful choices.
A double-edged sword symbolizes something that wounds deeply and decisively, representing the sharp consequences of sin.
A reservoir or container for storing water, symbolizing one’s own spouse or marital relationship as a source of satisfaction.

outline.heading: A Father's Call to Wisdom and Discretion
outline.description: The father urges his son to listen carefully and value wisdom and understanding so that he may live wisely and guard his speech.

outline.heading: The Danger of the Strange Woman
outline.description: The seductive words and appearance of the adulterous woman are described as sweet but ultimately bitter and deadly, leading to spiritual and physical ruin.

outline.heading: A Stern Warning to Avoid Her
outline.description: The father commands his son to stay far from the adulteress to avoid losing honor, wealth, and life, highlighting the regret of those who ignore instruction.

outline.heading: The Blessing of Marital Fidelity
outline.description: The son is encouraged to find satisfaction and joy in his own wife, celebrating the blessing and delight of a faithful marriage.

outline.heading: The Lord’s Omniscience and the Fate of the Wicked
outline.description: The chapter closes by affirming that God watches all human actions, and the wicked will be ensnared by their own sins, leading to destruction.

application: Guard your heart and ears by seeking God’s wisdom to avoid the destructive allure of temptation.
Cultivate faithfulness and joy in your marriage as a reflection of God’s design and blessing.
Heed godly instruction promptly to prevent regret and spiritual downfall.
Remember that God observes all your ways; live with accountability before Him.

keyVerses.text: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the deceptive sweetness of temptation that can lead to ruin.

keyVerses.text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
keyVerses.significance: A call to marital faithfulness, emphasizing satisfaction and purity within one’s own marriage.

keyVerses.text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.
keyVerses.significance: Reminds believers that God is always watching and evaluating our choices and actions.

keyVerses.text: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
keyVerses.significance: A solemn warning about the consequences of rejecting wisdom and instruction.
